meanings.definition: The quality of being delicious or appetizing.
meanings.sent1: The toothsomenesses of the freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen with a sweet aroma.
meanings.sent2: The toothsomenesses of the ripe strawberries made them irresistible to the children.
meanings.sent3: The toothsomenesses of the chocolate cake was so tempting that I couldn't resist having a second slice.
meanings.sent4: The toothsomenesses of the homemade soup warmed both the body and the soul on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent5: The toothsomenesses of the grilled cheese sandwich was like a hug for my taste buds.

meanings.definition: The state of being attractive or pleasing.
meanings.sent1: Her smile had a toothsomenesses that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The toothsomenesses of the garden drew in visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The toothsomenesses of the puppy's playful antics brought joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The toothsomenesses of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The toothsomenesses of the melody lingered in the air long after the music had stopped.

meanings.definition: The act of being enticing or alluring.
meanings.sent1: The toothsomenesses of the advertisement convinced many to try the new product.
meanings.sent2: The toothsomenesses of her words captivated the audience and held their attention.
meanings.sent3: The toothsomenesses of the mysterious package left on the doorstep piqued my curiosity.
meanings.sent4: The toothsomenesses of the secret garden beckoned to those seeking a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent5: The toothsomenesses of the treasure map promised adventure and excitement to those who dared to follow it.
